unnormalised: **Question:** What are some yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine to improve my overall well-being?
normalised: **Question:** What are some yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine to improve my overall well-being?

unnormalised: As someone who grew up seeing my grandmother practice yoga every single morning in our ancestral home in Varanasi, I can vouch for its transformative power. It's more than just stretching; it's about connecting your mind, body, and spirit, as they teach you in the Isha Foundation courses.
normalised: As someone who grew up seeing my grandmother practice yoga every single morning in our ancestral home in Varanasi, I can vouch for its transformative power. It is more than just stretching; it is about connecting your mind, body, and spirit, as they teach you in the Isha Foundation courses.

unnormalised: One simple practice you can start with is Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations). Doing even 5-6 rounds in the morning can energize you for the entire day. Remember to breathe deeply and focus on each pose. Then, incorporating basic asanas like Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) or Virabhadrasana (Warrior Pose I and II) can improve your strength and balance. I remember seeing Deepika Padukone do a headstand effortlessly in "Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani" and thinking, "One day, I'll get there!"
normalised: One simple practice you can start with is Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations). Doing even five to six rounds in the morning can energize you for the entire day. Remember to breathe deeply and focus on each pose. Then, incorporating basic asanas like Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) or Virabhadrasana (Warrior Pose one and two) can improve your strength and balance. I remember seeing Deepika Padukone do a headstand effortlessly in "Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani" and thinking, "One day, I will get there!"

unnormalised: Another underrated practice is Pranayama, or breathing exercises. Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is incredibly calming and helps to reduce stress. Even 5 minutes of Anulom Vilom before bed can significantly improve your sleep quality.
normalised: Another underrated practice is Pranayama, or breathing exercises. Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is incredibly calming and helps to reduce stress. Even five minutes of Anulom Vilom before bed can significantly improve your sleep quality.

unnormalised: Don't underestimate the power of meditation. Even a short 10-minute session focusing on your breath can quiet the mind and reduce anxiety. Yoga Nidra (yogic sleep) is another great option for deep relaxation.
normalised: Don't underestimate the power of meditation. Even a short ten minute session focusing on your breath can quiet the mind and reduce anxiety. Yoga Nidra (yogic sleep) is another great option for deep relaxation.

unnormalised: Most importantly, listen to your body. Don’t push yourself too hard, especially when you're starting out. Consult a qualified yoga instructor if you have any injuries or health conditions. Gradually build up your practice, and you'll soon experience the amazing benefits of yoga. Just remember consistency is key!
